definitions.definition: A children's play area consisting of a box filled with sand.
A box filled with sand that is shaped to form a mould for metal casting.
A container for sand or pounce, used historically before blotting paper.
An animal's litter box.
A box carried on locomotives, from which sand runs onto the rails in front of the driving wheels, to prevent slipping.
An isolated area where a program can be executed with a restricted portion of the resources available.
definitions.example: Running a program in a sandbox can prevent it from doing any damage to the system.

definitions.definition: (Wiktionary and WMF jargon) A page on a wiki where users are free to experiment without destroying or damaging any legitimate content.
(usually "The Sandbox") The Middle East.
To restrict (a program, etc.) by placing it in a sandbox.
Pertaining to heat energy extracted from reservoirs in the earth's interior
An instance of spanking, separately or part of a multiple blows-beating; a smack, swat, or slap.
A slapping sound, as produced by spanking.
To beat, smack or slap a person's buttocks, with the bare hand or other object, as punishment, gesture, or form of sexual interaction.
To soundly defeat, to trounce.
To hit very hard
To move rapidly.
definitions.example: The ship was really spanking along.

definitions.definition: (slightly obsolete) A nightclub where dancing takes place.
A large room or building for indoor sports.
A type of secondary school in some European countries which typically prepares students for university.
A public place or building where Ancient Greek youths took exercise, with running and wrestling grounds, baths, and halls for conversation.
The action of rinsing.
definitions.example: I'll just give this knife a quick rinse.

definitions.definition: A liquid used to rinse, now particularly a hair dye.
To wash (something) quickly using water and no soap.
definitions.example: You'd better rinse that stain before putting the shirt in the washing machine.

definitions.definition: To remove soap from (something) using water.
definitions.example: Rinse the dishes after you wash them.

definitions.definition: To thoroughly defeat in an argument, fight or other competition.
definitions.example: Checkmate!

definitions.definition: Between the stars.
definitions.example: It can take centuries for light to travel interstellar distances.

definitions.definition: Among the stars.
definitions.example: Space is littered with interstellar particles.

definitions.definition: Cost, expenditure.
The act of dispensing, dispensation.
To issue, distribute, or give out.
To apply, as laws to particular cases; to administer; to execute; to manage; to direct.
definitions.example: to dispense justice

definitions.definition: To supply or make up a medicine or prescription.
definitions.example: An optician can dispense spectacles.

definitions.definition: To give a dispensation to (someone); to excuse.
To compensate; to make up; to make amends.
An insect in the development stage between larva and adult.
(conservation) To return an area to a more wild state, especially to repopulate it with wild animals.
Making or characterized by a noisy outcry; clamorous.
A performance on a mat-covered floor using no apparatus.
A colloquial word or phrase; a common spoken expression.
Colloquial style of speaking.
A local law
An edict or decree, authoritative order.
A religious practice or ritual prescribed by the church.
A small, high-pitched metal whistle with six holes that is blown using a fipple.
A supernatural being of varying size, now especially a grotesque humanoid creature living in caves or hills or under bridges.
An ugly person of either sex, especially one seeking sexual experiences.

Optical ejections from the top of the electrically active core regions of thunderstorms that are red in color that seem to occur after tendrils of vigorous sprites extend downward toward the cloud tops.
An instance of trolling, especially, in fishing, the trailing of a baited line.
A person who provokes others (chiefly on the Internet) for their own personal amusement or to cause disruption.
To saunter.
To trundle, to roll from side to side.
To draw someone or something out, to entice, to lure as if with trailing bait.
(by extension) To fish using a line and bait or lures trailed behind a boat similarly to trawling; to lure fish with bait.
To angle for with a trolling line, or with a hook drawn along the surface of the water; hence, to allure.
To fish in; to try to catch fish from.
To stroll about in order to find a sexual partner.
definitions.example: He spends most of his waking hours trolling on WIRE.

definitions.definition: (to post inflammatory material so as) to attempt to lure others into combative argument for purposes of personal entertainment and/or gratuitous disruption, especially in an online community or discussion
(by extension) To incite anger (including outside of an Internet context); to provoke, harass or annoy.
The act of moving round; routine; repetition.
A song whose parts are sung in succession; a catch; a round.
A trolley.
To move circularly; to roll; to turn.
To send about; to circulate, as a vessel in drinking.
To sing the parts of in succession, as of a round, a catch, and the like; also, to sing loudly, freely or in a carefree way.
A relaxing of tension, especially between countries.
A form of programming (cinematic, television, live action, games or any material) that provides both education and entertainment.
The part of a person's hairstyle which covers the forehead.
The part of a horse's (or similar animal's) mane that lies on its forehead.
A wedge pushed through a hole at the end of a bolt to hold it in place.
To fix in place with a forelock (wedge)
(chiefly in the plural) Something incidental to the main subject, but of less importance.
definitions.example: the circumstantials of religion

definitions.definition: Pertaining to or dependent on circumstances, especially as opposed to essentials; incidental, not essential.
Abounding with minor circumstances; in great detail; particular.
Full of circumstance or pomp; ceremonial.
Suggesting guilt, but not proving it conclusively.
definitions.example: It is unlikely he will be convicted; the evidence against him is circumstantial at best.

definitions.definition: A state of long-standing mutual hostility.
definitions.example: You couldn't call it a feud exactly, but there had always been a chill between Phil Mickelson and Tiger Woods.

definitions.definition: A staged rivalry between wrestlers.
A combination of kindred to avenge injuries or affronts, done or offered to any of their blood, on the offender and all his race.
To carry on a feud.
definitions.example: The two men began to feud after one of them got a job promotion and the other thought he was more qualified.

definitions.definition: An estate granted to a vassal by a feudal lord in exchange for service.
Showing empathy for others, and recognizing their feelings; empathic
Obtrusively pushy; self-assertive to a pretentious extreme.
An arrangement that allows employees to set their own working hours within agreed limits; normally must include certain periods (core time) when they must be at work.
Someone who runs a hotel
An appetizer made from yoghurt, cucumber, garlic, olive oil and dill or mint; usually served with pitta bread and as a meze
A person whose occupation is to clean floors, windows and other things.
A device that cleans, such as the vacuum cleaner.
A substance used for cleaning, a cleaning agent.

(in the plural) A professional laundry or dry cleaner (business). (This form is now interpreted as plural and usually spelled without an apostrophe, even in official usage, to justify the removal of the apostrophe. It was traditionally spelled cleaner's with an apostrophe because this is grammatically correct, as can be seen with forms such as go to the doctor's, which cannot be reinterpreted as plural.)
definitions.example: I'll have to take this shirt to the cleaners.

definitions.definition: (heading, physical) Free of dirt or impurities or protruberances.
(heading, behavioural) Free of immorality or criminality.
Smooth, exact, and performed well
definitions.example: I’ll need a sharper knife to make clean cuts.  a clean leap over a fence

definitions.definition: Total; utter. (still in "clean sweep")
Cool or neat.
definitions.example: Wow, Dude, those are some clean shoes ya got there!

definitions.definition: (health) Being free of sexually transmitted diseases (STDs).
definitions.example: I want to make sure my fiancé is clean before we are married.

definitions.definition: That does not damage the environment.
definitions.example: clean energy;  clean coal

definitions.definition: Free from that which is useless or injurious; without defects.
definitions.example: clean land;  clean timber

definitions.definition: Free from restraint or neglect; complete; entire.
Well-proportioned; shapely.
definitions.example: clean limbs

definitions.definition: (of a route) Ascended without falling.
A virtual ticket, especially for a flight, that is issued electronically.
A road or path within an airport designated for the taxiing of aircraft connecting the runways with ramps, hangars, terminals and other facilities.
To emit sparks; to throw off ignited or incandescent particles
definitions.example: The wood was sparkling in the bonfire.

definitions.definition: (by extension) To shine as if throwing off sparks; to emit flashes of light; to scintillate; to twinkle
definitions.example: The stars sparkle in the sky.

definitions.definition: To manifest itself by, or as if by, emitting sparks; to glisten; to flash.
To emit little bubbles, as certain kinds of liquors; to effervesce
definitions.example: sparkling water

definitions.definition: To emit in the form or likeness of sparks.
To disperse.
To scatter on or over.
Act or appearance of something that sparkles; a sparkle; a gleam.
A sparkling wine.
Of an object, reflecting light as if giving off tiny sparks.
Of a beverage, especially an alcoholic beverage, containing dissolved carbon dioxide (either naturally or that has been added) that comes out of solution in the form of many tiny bubbles.
Brilliant and vivacious.
A bowl held by a beggar seeking money and food.
(figurative) Used in reference to a plea for help.
definitions.example: Portugal has gone to the British government with a begging bowl asking for relaxation of quarantine restrictions.

definitions.definition: An optical phenomenon which creates a bright spot around the shadow of the viewer's head, when the surface on which the shadow falls has special optical characteristics (as with dewy grass).
A place notable for a high level of activity or danger.
A part of an application that consumes a significant amount of execution time.
Part of a control that responds dynamically as the user moves the pointer over it, as for example in an image map.
A location in which WiFi Internet access is available.
The region of a gene in which there is higher than normal rate of mutation.
The surface manifestation of a plume that rises from deep in the celestial body's mantle.
The Chinese tropical fruit tree Litchi chinensis, of the soapberry family.
That tree's bright red oval fruit with a single stone surrounded by a fleshy white aril.
A soft pink-red colour, like that of a lychee rind (also called lychee red).
A body of water, such as a river, channel or canal, that is navigable.
A conduit or watercourse, such as on the deck of a ship, to drain water.
An instance of bungee jumping.
To participate in bungee jumping
A percussion instrument consisting of a drum made of steel, originally from Trinidad.
A style of music incorporating steelpans.
The state of being redundant
A superfluity; something redundant or excessive; a needless repetition in language
Duplication of components or circuits to provide survival of the total system in case of failure of single components.
Duplication of parts of a message to guard against transmission errors.
The state of being unemployed because one's job is no longer necessary; the dismissal of such an employee; a layoff.
Surplusage inserted in a pleading which may be rejected by the court without impairing the validity of what remains.
One who squats, sits down idly.
One who occupies a building or land without title or permission.
A large-scale grazier and landowner.
A squat toilet.
Someone who inherits, or is designated to inherit, the property of another.
One who inherits, or has been designated to inherit, a hereditary title or office.
A successor in a role, representing continuity with the predecessor.
To inherit.
Region outside explored space.
Any region of space beyond limits determined with reference to boundaries of a celestial system or body, especially the region of space immediately beyond Earth's atmosphere.
A bluish shade of black.
To compose (a document), especially following a standard form.
definitions.example: I asked my lawyer to draw up a new will.

definitions.definition: To arrange in order or formation.
definitions.example: Sergeant, please draw the men up in ranks of three.

definitions.definition: To cause to come to a halt.
definitions.example: Draw up the carriage just around the corner!

definitions.definition: To come to a halt.
definitions.example: The tractor drew up alongside the haystack.

definitions.definition: To withdraw upwards.
A white, crystalline powder, C7H5NO3S, used as an artificial sweetener in food products
Any aircraft capable of taking off from, and alighting on the surface of water.
Having a kind personality; kind, warmhearted, sympathetic.
definitions.example: A kindly old man sits on the park bench every afternoon feeding pigeons.

definitions.definition: Favourable, gentle, pleasant, tidy, auspicious, beneficent.
Lawful.
Natural; inherent to the kind or race.
In a kind manner, out of kindness.
definitions.example: He kindly offered to take us to the station in his car.

definitions.definition: In a favourable way.
Used to make a polite request: please.
definitions.example: Kindly move your car out of the front yard.

definitions.definition: With kind acceptance; used with take.
definitions.example: Aunt Daisy didn't take it kindly when we forgot her anniversary.

definitions.definition: Kind of, somewhat.
Readily.
Naturally.
A bold, broad, and subjective moral generalization on a situation, with little or no original analysis or insight, especially by a journalist.
The lowest rank of a commissioned officer in the RAF, equivalent to an Army ensign or coronet
Acting too quickly without considering the risks and consequences; not careful; hasty.
definitions.example: rash words spoken in the heat of debate

definitions.definition: So dry as to fall out of the ear with handling, as corn.
Requiring sudden action; pressing; urgent.
Fast-acting.
An area of reddened, irritated, and inflamed skin.
A surge in problems; a spate, string or trend.
definitions.example: There has been a rash of vandalism lately.

definitions.definition: To prepare with haste.
An inferior kind of silk, or mixture of silk and worsted.
To pull off or pluck violently.
To slash; to hack; to slice.
To cause (a person or animal) to be fat or fatter.
definitions.example: We must fatten the turkey in time for Thanksgiving.

definitions.definition: (of a person or animal) To become fat or fatter.
definitions.example: He gradually fattened in the five years after getting married.

definitions.definition: To make thick or thicker (something containing paper, often money).
To become thick or thicker.
To make (soil) fertile and fruitful.
definitions.example: to fatten land

definitions.definition: To become fertile and fruitful.
The act of making something fatter, particularly in reference or allusion to livestock.
The act of becoming fatter.
That causes weight gain; often of high calorie food with relatively little nutritive value.
The pipes, together with the joints, tanks, stopcocks, taps and other fixtures of a water, gas or sewage system in a house or other building.
The trade or occupation of a plumber.
A system of vessels or ducts in the human body, especially the genitourinary system.
definitions.example: My plumbing was playing up, so I had to see the doctor.

definitions.definition: Practical, concrete work serving to support other work.
definitions.example: This is not scientific research as such: it's just plumbing.

definitions.definition: A Murasugi sum where each disk summed along has its boundary subdivided into four segments.
A ribbed tubular form of pasta, larger than penne but with square-cut ends, often slightly curved.
A lake.
A bay or arm of the sea.
A medicine in a soft form taken by licking; a lambative, a linctus.
The core, central part of something, around which other elements are assembled.
An initial part or version that will receive additions.
definitions.example: This collection will form the nucleus of a new library.

definitions.definition: The massive, positively charged central part of an atom, made up of protons and neutrons.
A large membrane-enclosed organelle found in eukaryotic cells which contains genetic material.
A ganglion, cluster of many neuronal bodies where synapsing occurs.
The central part of a syllable, most commonly a vowel.
A noisy quarrel or fight.
The front part of a vessel
A vessel
Brave, valiant, gallant.
A sailing vessel found in the waters of Micronesia and Indonesia; it has a single, large outrigger and a triangular sail.
A cocktail consisting of bourbon whiskey, sugar, water and mint leaves.

Any (typically wooden) musical instrument that produces sound by the player blowing into it, through a reed, or across an opening. Woodwind instruments include the recorder, flute, piccolo, clarinet, oboe, cor anglais and bassoon.
A horse chestnut, used in the game of conkers.
To rebuke, to reprimand, or to admonish, often in a harsh, angry, direct way.
definitions.example: Joel's boss told him off for being late again.

definitions.definition: To count (members of a sequence), to enumerate.
To allocate duties to someone.
To divide and practise a regiment or company in the several formations, preparatory to marching to the general parade for field exercises.

synonyms: give somebody a piece of one's mind

definitions.definition: An escape from prison.
An escape from any restrictive or confining situation.
An outbreak.
A breakdown of statistics; a detailed view of component parts.
A room in a hotel etc. that can be taken by a smaller group at a large conference.
Of a book, film, or other work: leading its author to mainstream success.
(of food or drink) Providing nutrients; healthy to eat.
A carer.
A son of one's sibling, brother-in-law, or sister-in-law; either a son of one's brother (fraternal nephew) or a son of one's sister (sororal nephew).
A son of one's child.
A female astronaut.
A law enacted by a legislative body, as opposed to a regulation made by the executive branch.
The complete corpus of laws enacted by legislation and currently in effect within a jurisdiction, as opposed to regulation.
A soft tap or blow; a blow or peck from a bird's beak; an aimed blow.
A soft, playful box given in greeting or approval.
A small amount, a blob of some soft or wet substance.
definitions.example: a dab of glue

definitions.definition: (chiefly in the plural) Fingerprint.
A hip hop dance move in which the dancer simultaneously drops the head while raising an arm, briefly resting their face in the elbow, as if sneezing into their elbow.
To press lightly in a repetitive motion with a soft object without rubbing.
definitions.example: I dabbed my face with a towel.

definitions.definition: To apply a substance in this way.
definitions.example: He dabbed moisturizing liquid on his face.

definitions.definition: To strike by a thrust; to hit with a sudden blow or thrust.
To apply hash oil to a heated surface for the purpose of efficient combustion.
To perform the dab dance move, by moving both arms to one side of the body parallel with your head.
With a dab, or sudden contact.
One skilful or proficient; an expert; an adept.
A small flatfish of the family Pleuronectidae, especially Limanda limanda; a flounder.
A sand dab, a small flatfish of genus Citharichthys.
(costers) Bad.
The production of high-end, custom-made clothing
A device used to support a person sitting up in bed.
Confinement to bed, often under instructions of a physician, in order to recover from an injury, an illness, or the frailty associated with other physical discomforts such as a difficult pregnancy.
Able to be dissolved.
definitions.example: Sugar is soluble in water.

definitions.definition: Able to be solved or explained.
definitions.example: That mystery should be easily soluble.

definitions.definition: A frame consisting of two bars crossing each other at right angles and turning on a post or pin, to hinder the passage of animals, but admitting a person to pass between the arms; a turnstile.
A gate or bar set across a road to stop carriages, animals, and sometimes people, until a toll is paid,
A winding stairway.
A beam filled with spikes to obstruct passage; a cheval de frise.
A toll road, especially a toll expressway.
(mathematical economics) A trajectory on a finite time interval that satisfies an optimality criterion which is associated with a cost function.
To form (a road, etc.) in the manner of a turnpike road; into a rounded form, as the path of a road.
The diversity (number and variety of species) of plant and animal life within a region.
The breast portion of poultry.
Meats whose color, either before or after cooking, is considered white as opposed to red, including poultry, seafood, and in some uses, even pork.
Any academic or scientific study that draws on the expertise of more than one discipline.
Op shop
A covering used to protect or disguise the face.
A facial mask.
The part of the helmet that directly covers the face, made of one or more plastic-coated metal bars.
The foul of grasping it during play.
A substance that aids digestion.
A digestive biscuit.
definitions.example: I bought a packet of chocolate digestives.

definitions.definition: Of, relating to, or functioning in digestion.
That causes or promotes digestion.
A passage, hall or room, such as a lobby, between the outer door and the interior of a building.
An enclosed entrance at the end of a railway passenger car.
(by extension) Any of a number of body cavities, serving as or resembling an entrance to another bodily space.
To furnish with a vestibule or vestibules.
A perennial plant; a plant that is active throughout the year or survives for more than two growing seasons.
Lasting or remaining active throughout the year, or all the time.
definitions.example: a perennial stream

definitions.definition: (of a plant) Having a life cycle of more than two years.
Continuing without cessation or intermission; perpetual; never failing.
Enduring; lasting; timeless.
definitions.example: His artwork has a perennial beauty.

definitions.definition: Recurrent; appearing or recurring again and again.
definitions.example: Change is a perennial theme in politics.

definitions.definition: Juicy, succulent.
Mellow; soft; (of ground or soil) easily turned; fertile.
(of vegetation) Dense, teeming with life; luxuriant.
(of food) Savoury, delicious.
definitions.example: That meal was lush! We have to go that restaurant again sometime!

definitions.definition: (miscellaneous) Thriving; rife; sumptuous.
Beautiful, sexy.
definitions.example: Boys with long hair are lush!

definitions.definition: Amazing, cool, fantastic, wicked.
definitions.example: Your voice is lush, Lucy! I could listen to it all day!

definitions.definition: Lax; slack; limp; flexible.
Drunkard, sot, alcoholic.
Intoxicating liquor.
(Pidgin) A person who enjoys talking about themselves
definitions.example: Am I humble or am I a lush?

definitions.definition: To drink (liquor) to excess.
The scientific study of the formation, classification, mapping, and the physical, chemical and biological properties of soil.
To end work; to officially record a time when one terminates a period of work.
definitions.example: If we clock out now we can be at the bar by happy hour.

definitions.definition: To officially record a work-termination time for.
definitions.example: I clocked myself out as soon as I could.

definitions.definition: To transmit individual bits of data under the control of a clock.
One who delivers the news for broadcast on television, radio, etc; a newsreader.
Orderly government; system of order; administration.
Any regulation or remedy which is intended to produce beneficial effects by gradual operation.
(grammar) object
(grammar) A syntactical relation between words, as when one depends on another and is regulated by it in respect to case or mood; government.
Diet; limitations on the food that one eats, for health reasons.
